013package org.apache.juneau.bean.swagger;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ClassUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConverterUtils.*;
019
020import java.util.*;
021
022import org.apache.juneau.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.json.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.objecttools.*;
029
030/**
031 * This is the root document object for the API specification.
032 *
033 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
034 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../index.html#jrs.Swagger">Overview &gt; juneau-rest-server &gt; Swagger</a>
035 * </ul>
036 */
037@Bean(properties="swagger,info,tags,externalDocs,basePath,schemes,consumes,produces,paths,definitions,parameters,responses,securityDefinitions,security,*")
038@FluentSetters
039public class Swagger extends SwaggerElement {
040
041   /** Represents a null swagger */
042   public static final Swagger NULL = new Swagger();
043
044   private static final Comparator<String> PATH_COMPARATOR = (o1, o2) -> o1.replace('{', '@').compareTo(o2.replace('{', '@'));
045
046   private String
047      swagger = "2.0",  // NOSONAR - Intentional naming.
048      host,
049      basePath;
050   private Info info;
051   private ExternalDocumentation externalDocs;
052   private Set<String> schemes;
053   private Set<MediaType>
054      consumes,
055      produces;
056   private Set<Tag> tags;
057   private List<Map<String,List<String>>> security;
058   private Map<String,JsonMap> definitions;
059   private Map<String,ParameterInfo> parameters;
060   private Map<String,ResponseInfo> responses;
061   private Map<String,SecurityScheme> securityDefinitions;
062   private Map<String,OperationMap> paths;
063
064   /**
065    * Default constructor.
066    */
067   public Swagger() {}
068
069   /**
070    * Copy constructor.
071    *
072    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
073    */
074   public Swagger(Swagger copyFrom) {
075      super(copyFrom);
076
077      this.basePath = copyFrom.basePath;
078      this.consumes = copyOf(copyFrom.consumes);
079      this.externalDocs = copyFrom.externalDocs == null ? null : copyFrom.externalDocs.copy();
080      this.host = copyFrom.host;
081      this.info = copyFrom.info == null ? null : copyFrom.info.copy();
082      this.produces = copyOf(copyFrom.produces);
083      this.schemes = copyOf(copyFrom.schemes);
084      this.swagger = copyFrom.swagger;
085
086      // TODO - Definitions are not deep copied, so they should not contain references.
087      this.definitions = copyOf(copyFrom.definitions, JsonMap::new);
088
089      this.paths = copyOf(copyFrom.paths, v -> {
090         var m = new OperationMap();
091         v.forEach((k2,v2) -> m.put(k2, v2.copy()));
092         return m;
093      });
094
095      this.parameters = copyOf(copyFrom.parameters, ParameterInfo::copy);
096      this.responses = copyOf(copyFrom.responses, ResponseInfo::copy);
097      this.securityDefinitions = copyOf(copyFrom.securityDefinitions, SecurityScheme::copy);
098
099      this.security = copyOf(copyFrom.security, x -> {
100         Map<String,List<String>> m2 = map();
101         x.forEach((k,v) -> m2.put(k, copyOf(v)));
102         return m2;
103      });
104
105      this.tags = copyOf(copyFrom.tags, x -> x.copy());
106   }
107
108   /**
109    * Make a deep copy of this object.
110    *
111    * @return A deep copy of this object.
112    */
113   public Swagger copy() {
114      return new Swagger(this);
115   }
116
117   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
118   // Properties
119   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
120
121   /**
122    * Bean property getter:  <property>basePath</property>.
123    *
124    * <p>
125    * The base path on which the API is served, which is relative to the <c>host</c>.
126    *
127    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
128    */
129   public String getBasePath() {
130      return basePath;
131   }
132
133   /**
134    * Bean property setter:  <property>basePath</property>.
135    *
136    * <p>
137    * The base path on which the API is served, which is relative to the <c>host</c>.
138    *
139    * @param value
140    *    The new value for this property.
141    *    <br>If it is not included, the API is served directly under the <c>host</c>.
142    *    <br>The value MUST start with a leading slash (/).
143    *    <br>The <c>basePath</c> does not support <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#pathTemplating">path templating</a>.
144    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
145    * @return This object.
146    */
147   public Swagger setBasePath(String value) {
148      basePath = value;
149      return this;
150   }
151
152   /**
153    * Bean property getter:  <property>consumes</property>.
154    *
155    * <p>
156    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
157    *
158    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
159    */
160   public Set<MediaType> getConsumes() {
161      return consumes;
162   }
163
164   /**
165    * Bean property setter:  <property>consumes</property>.
166    *
167    * <p>
168    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
169    *
170    * @param value
171    *    The new value for this property.
172    *    <br>Value MUST be as described under <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification#mimeTypes">Swagger Mime Types</a>.
173    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
174    * @return This object.
175    */
176   public Swagger setConsumes(Collection<MediaType> value) {
177      consumes = setFrom(value);
178      return this;
179   }
180
181   /**
182    * Bean property appender:  <property>consumes</property>.
183    *
184    * <p>
185    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
186    *
187    * @param values
188    *    The values to add to this property.
189    *    <br>Values MUST be as described under <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification#mimeTypes">Swagger Mime Types</a>.
190    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
191    * @return This object.
192    */
193   public Swagger addConsumes(MediaType...values) {
194      consumes = setBuilder(consumes).sparse().add(values).build();
195      return this;
196   }
197
198   /**
199    * Bean property fluent setter:  <property>consumes</property>.
200    *
201    * <p>
202    * A list of MIME types the APIs can consume.
203    *
204    * @param value
205    *    The values to set on this property.
206    * @return This object.
207    */
208   public Swagger setConsumes(MediaType...value) {
209      setConsumes(setBuilder(MediaType.class).sparse().add(value).build());
210      return this;
211   }
212
213   /**
214    * Bean property getter:  <property>definitions</property>.
215    *
216    * <p>
217    * An object to hold data types produced and consumed by operations.
218    *
219    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
220    */
221   public Map<String,JsonMap> getDefinitions() {
222      return definitions;
223   }
224
225   /**
226    * Bean property setter:  <property>definitions</property>.
227    *
228    * <p>
229    * An object to hold data types produced and consumed by operations.
230    *
231    * @param value
232    *    The new value for this property.
233    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
234    * @return This object.
235    */
236   public Swagger setDefinitions(Map<String,JsonMap> value) {
237      definitions = copyOf(value);
238      return this;
239   }
240
241   /**
242    * Bean property appender:  <property>definitions</property>.
243    *
244    * <p>
245    * Adds a single value to the <property>definitions</property> property.
246    *
247    * @param name A definition name.
248    * @param schema The schema that the name defines.
249    * @return This object.
250    */
251   public Swagger addDefinition(String name, JsonMap schema) {
252      definitions = mapBuilder(definitions).sparse().add(name, schema).build();
253      return this;
254   }

265      return externalDocs;

276    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.

279   public Swagger setExternalDocs(ExternalDocumentation value) {
280      externalDocs = value;
281      return this;
282   }

284   /**
285    * Bean property getter:  <property>host</property>.
286    *
287    * <p>
288    * The host (name or IP) serving the API.
289    *
290    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
291    */
292   public String getHost() {
293      return host;
294   }
295
296   /**
297    * Bean property setter:  <property>host</property>.
298    *
299    * <p>
300    * The host (name or IP) serving the API.
301    *
302    * @param value
303    *    The new value for this property.
304    *    <br>This MUST be the host only and does not include the scheme nor sub-paths.
305    *    <br>It MAY include a port.
306    *    <br>If the host is not included, the host serving the documentation is to be used (including the port).
307    *    <br>The host does not support <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#pathTemplating">path templating</a>
308    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
309    * @return This object.
310    */
311   public Swagger setHost(String value) {
312      host = value;
313      return this;
314   }
315
316   /**
317    * Bean property getter:  <property>info</property>.
318    *
319    * <p>
320    * Provides metadata about the API.
321    *
322    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
323    */
324   public Info getInfo() {
325      return info;
326   }
327
328   /**
329    * Bean property setter:  <property>info</property>.
330    *
331    * <p>
332    * Provides metadata about the API.
333    *
334    * @param value
335    *    The new value for this property.
336    *    <br>Property value is required.
337    * @return This object.
338    */
339   public Swagger setInfo(Info value) {
340      info = value;
341      return this;
342   }

344   /**
345    * Bean property getter:  <property>parameters</property>.
346    *
347    * <p>
348    * An object to hold parameters that can be used across operations.
349    *
350    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
351    */
352   public Map<String,ParameterInfo> getParameters() {
353      return parameters;
354   }
355
356   /**
357    * Bean property setter:  <property>parameters</property>.
358    *
359    * <p>
360    * An object to hold parameters that can be used across operations.
361    *
362    * @param value
363    *    The new value for this property.
364    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
365    * @return This object.
366    */
367   public Swagger setParameters(Map<String,ParameterInfo> value) {
368      parameters = copyOf(value);
369      return this;
370   }
371
372   /**
373    * Bean property appender:  <property>parameters</property>.
374    *
375    * <p>
376    * Adds a single value to the <property>parameter</property> property.
377    *
378    * @param name The parameter name.
379    * @param parameter The parameter definition.
380    * @return This object.
381    */
382   public Swagger addParameter(String name, ParameterInfo parameter) {
383      parameters = mapBuilder(parameters).sparse().add(name, parameter).build();
384      return this;
385   }
386
387   /**
388    * Bean property getter:  <property>paths</property>.
389    *
390    * <p>
391    * The available paths and operations for the API.
392    *
393    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
394    */
395   public Map<String,OperationMap> getPaths() {
396      return paths;
397   }
398
399   /**
400    * Bean property setter:  <property>paths</property>.
401    *
402    * <p>
403    * The available paths and operations for the API.
404    *
405    * @param value
406    *    The new value for this property.
407    *    <br>Property value is required.
408    * @return This object.
409    */
410   public Swagger setPaths(Map<String,OperationMap> value) {
411      paths = mapBuilder(String.class,OperationMap.class).sparse().sorted(PATH_COMPARATOR).addAll(value).build();
412      return this;
413   }
414
415   /**
416    * Bean property appender:  <property>paths</property>.
417    *
418    * <p>
419    * Adds a single value to the <property>paths</property> property.
420    *
421    * @param path The path template.
422    * @param methodName The HTTP method name.
423    * @param operation The operation that describes the path.
424    * @return This object.
425    */
426   public Swagger addPath(String path, String methodName, Operation operation) {
427      if (paths == null)
428         paths = new TreeMap<>(PATH_COMPARATOR);
429      getPaths().computeIfAbsent(path, k -> new OperationMap()).put(methodName, operation);
430      return this;
431   }
432
433   /**
434    * Bean property getter:  <property>produces</property>.
435    *
436    * <p>
437    * A list of MIME types the APIs can produce.
438    *
439    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
440    */
441   public Set<MediaType> getProduces() {
442      return produces;
443   }
444

454    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
455    * @return This object.
456    */
457   public Swagger setProduces(Collection<MediaType> value) {
458      produces = setFrom(value);
459      return this;
460   }
461

471    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.

476      return this;

529    * @param response The response definition.
530    * @return This object.
531    */
532   public Swagger addResponse(String name, ResponseInfo response) {
533      responses = mapBuilder(responses).sparse().add(name, response).build();
534      return this;
535   }

537   /**
538    * Bean property getter:  <property>schemes</property>.
539    *
540    * <p>
541    * The transfer protocol of the API.
542    *
543    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
544    */
545   public Set<String> getSchemes() {
546      return schemes;
547   }
548
549   /**
550    * Bean property setter:  <property>schemes</property>.
551    *
552    * <p>
553    * The transfer protocol of the API.
554    *
555    * @param value
556    *    The new value for this property.
557    *    <br>Valid values:
558    *    <ul>
559    *       <li><js>"http"</js>
560    *       <li><js>"https"</js>
561    *       <li><js>"ws"</js>
562    *       <li><js>"wss"</js>
563    *    </ul>
564    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
565    * @return This object.
566    */
567   public Swagger setSchemes(Collection<String> value) {
568      schemes = setFrom(value);
569      return this;
570   }
571
572   /**
573    * Bean property appender:  <property>schemes</property>.
574    *
575    * <p>
576    * The transfer protocol of the API.
577    *
578    * @param values
579    *    The values to add to this property.
580    *    <br>Valid values:
581    *    <ul>
582    *       <li><js>"http"</js>
583    *       <li><js>"https"</js>
584    *       <li><js>"ws"</js>
585    *       <li><js>"wss"</js>
586    *    </ul>
587    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
588    * @return This object.
589    */
590   public Swagger addSchemes(String...values) {
591      schemes = setBuilder(schemes).sparse().add(values).build();
592      return this;
593   }
594
595   /**
596    * Bean property fluent setter:  <property>schemes</property>.
597    *
598    * <p>
599    * The transfer protocol of the API.
600    *
601    * @param value
602    *    The new value for this property.
603    *    <br>Strings can be JSON arrays.
604    * @return This object.
605    */
606   public Swagger setSchemes(String...value) {
607      setSchemes(setBuilder(String.class).sparse().addJson(value).build());
608      return this;
609   }
610
611   /**
612    * Bean property getter:  <property>security</property>.
613    *
614    * <p>
615    * A declaration of which security schemes are applied for the API as a whole.
616    *
617    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
618    */
619   public List<Map<String,List<String>>> getSecurity() {
620      return security;
621   }
622
623   /**
624    * Bean property setter:  <property>security</property>.
625    *
626    * <p>
627    * A declaration of which security schemes are applied for the API as a whole.
628    *
629    * @param value
630    *    The new value for this property.
631    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
632    * @return This object.
633    */
634   public Swagger setSecurity(Collection<Map<String,List<String>>> value) {
635      security = listFrom(value);
636      return this;
637   }
638
639   /**
640    * Bean property appender:  <property>security</property>.
641    *
642    * <p>
643    * Adds a single value to the <property>securityDefinitions</property> property.
644    *
645    * @param scheme The security scheme that applies to this operation
646    * @param alternatives
647    *    The list of values describes alternative security schemes that can be used (that is, there is a logical OR between the security requirements).
648    * @return This object.
649    */
650   public Swagger addSecurity(String scheme, String...alternatives) {
651      Map<String,List<String>> m = map();
652      m.put(scheme, alist(alternatives));
653      security = listBuilder(security).sparse().addAll(Collections.singleton(m)).build();
654      return this;
655   }
656
657   /**
658    * Bean property getter:  <property>securityDefinitions</property>.
659    *
660    * <p>
661    * Security scheme definitions that can be used across the specification.
662    *
663    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
664    */
665   public Map<String,SecurityScheme> getSecurityDefinitions() {
666      return securityDefinitions;
667   }
668
669   /**
670    * Bean property setter:  <property>securityDefinitions</property>.
671    *
672    * <p>
673    * Security scheme definitions that can be used across the specification.
674    *
675    * @param value
676    *    The new value for this property.
677    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
678    * @return This object.
679    */
680   public Swagger setSecurityDefinitions(Map<String,SecurityScheme> value) {
681      securityDefinitions = copyOf(value);
682      return this;
683   }
684
685   /**
686    * Bean property appender:  <property>securityDefinitions</property>.
687    *
688    * <p>
689    * Adds a single value to the <property>securityDefinitions</property> property.
690    *
691    * @param name A security name.
692    * @param securityScheme A security schema.
693    * @return This object.
694    */
695   public Swagger addSecurityDefinition(String name, SecurityScheme securityScheme) {
696      securityDefinitions = mapBuilder(securityDefinitions).sparse().add(name, securityScheme).build();
697      return this;
698   }

700   /**
701    * Bean property getter:  <property>swagger</property>.

704    * Specifies the Swagger Specification version being used.
705    *
706    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
707    */
708   public String getSwagger() {
709      return swagger;
710   }
711
712   /**
713    * Bean property setter:  <property>swagger</property>.
714    *
715    * <p>
716    * Specifies the Swagger Specification version being used.
717    *
718    * @param value
719    *    The new value for this property.
720    *    <br>Property value is required.
721    * @return This object.
722    */
723   public Swagger setSwagger(String value) {
724      swagger = value;
725      return this;
726   }
727
728   /**
729    * Bean property getter:  <property>tags</property>.
730    *
731    * <p>
732    * A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata.
733    *
734    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
735    */
736   public Set<Tag> getTags() {
737      return tags;
738   }
739
740   /**
741    * Bean property setter:  <property>tags</property>.
742    *
743    * <p>
744    * A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata.
745    *
746    * @param value
747    *    The new value for this property.
748    *    <br>The order of the tags can be used to reflect on their order by the parsing tools.
749    *    <br>Not all tags that are used by the <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#operationObject">Operation Object</a> must be declared.
750    *    <br>The tags that are not declared may be organized randomly or based on the tools' logic.
751    *    <br>Each tag name in the list MUST be unique.
752    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
753    * @return This object.
754    */
755   public Swagger setTags(Collection<Tag> value) {
756      tags = setFrom(value);
757      return this;
758   }
759
760   /**
761    * Bean property appender:  <property>tags</property>.
762    *
763    * <p>
764    * A list of tags used by the specification with additional metadata.
765    *
766    * @param values
767    *    The values to add to this property.
768    *    <br>The order of the tags can be used to reflect on their order by the parsing tools.
769    *    <br>Not all tags that are used by the <a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/specification/v2#operationObject">Operation Object</a> must be declared.
770    *    <br>The tags that are not declared may be organized randomly or based on the tools' logic.
771    *    <br>Each tag name in the list MUST be unique.
772    *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk>.
773    * @return This object.
774    */
775   public Swagger addTags(Tag...values) {
776      tags = setBuilder(tags).sparse().add(values).build();
777      return this;
778   }
779
780   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
781   // Convenience methods
782   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
783
784   /**
785    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path);</c>
786    *
787    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).
788    * @return The operation map for the specified path, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
789    */
790   public OperationMap getPath(String path) {
791      return getPaths().get(path);
792   }
793
794   /**
795    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path).get(operation);</c>
796    *
797    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).
798    * @param operation The HTTP operation (e.g. <js>"get"</js>).
799    * @return The operation for the specified path and operation id, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
800    */
801   public Operation getOperation(String path, String operation) {
802      var om = getPath(path);
803      if (om == null)
804         return null;
805      return om.get(operation);
806   }
807
808   /**
809    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path).get(operation).getResponse(status);</c>
810    *
811    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).
812    * @param operation The HTTP operation (e.g. <js>"get"</js>).
813    * @param status The HTTP response status (e.g. <js>"200"</js>).
814    * @return The operation for the specified path and operation id, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
815    */
816   public ResponseInfo getResponseInfo(String path, String operation, String status) {
817      var om = getPath(path);
818      if (om == null)
819         return null;
820      var op = om.get(operation);
821      if (op == null)
822         return null;
823      return op.getResponse(status);
824   }
825
826   /**
827    * Shortcut for calling <c>getPaths().get(path).get(operation).getResponse(status);</c>
828    *
829    * @param path The path (e.g. <js>"/foo"</js>).
830    * @param operation The HTTP operation (e.g. <js>"get"</js>).
831    * @param status The HTTP response status (e.g. <js>"200"</js>).
832    * @return The operation for the specified path and operation id, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
833    */
834   public ResponseInfo getResponseInfo(String path, String operation, int status) {
835      return getResponseInfo(path, operation, String.valueOf(status));
836   }
837
838   /**
839    * Convenience method for calling <c>getPath(path).get(method).getParameter(in,name);</c>
840    *
841    * @param path The HTTP path.
842    * @param method The HTTP method.
843    * @param in The parameter type.
844    * @param name The parameter name.
845    * @return The parameter information or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
846    */
847   public ParameterInfo getParameterInfo(String path, String method, String in, String name) {
848      var om = getPath(path);
849      if (om != null) {
850         var o = om.get(method);
851         if (o != null) {
852            return o.getParameter(in, name);
853         }
854      }
855      return null;
856   }
857
858   // <FluentSetters>
859
860   // </FluentSetters>
861
862   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
863   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
864      if (property == null)
865         return null;
866      return switch (property) {
867         case "basePath" -> toType(getBasePath(), type);
868         case "consumes" -> toType(getConsumes(), type);
869         case "definitions" -> toType(getDefinitions(), type);
870         case "externalDocs" -> toType(getExternalDocs(), type);
871         case "host" -> toType(getHost(), type);
872         case "info" -> toType(getInfo(), type);
873         case "parameters" -> toType(getParameters(), type);
874         case "paths" -> toType(getPaths(), type);
875         case "produces" -> toType(getProduces(), type);
876         case "responses" -> toType(getResponses(), type);
877         case "schemes" -> toType(getSchemes(), type);
878         case "security" -> toType(getSecurity(), type);
879         case "securityDefinitions" -> toType(getSecurityDefinitions(), type);
880         case "swagger" -> toType(getSwagger(), type);
881         case "tags" -> toType(getTags(), type);
882         default -> super.get(property, type);
883      };
884   }
885
886   @SuppressWarnings("rawtypes")
887   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
888   public Swagger set(String property, Object value) {
889      if (property == null)
890         return this;
891      return switch (property) {
892         case "basePath" -> setBasePath(Utils.s(value));
893         case "consumes" -> setConsumes(listBuilder(MediaType.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
894         case "definitions" -> setDefinitions(mapBuilder(String.class,JsonMap.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
895         case "externalDocs" -> setExternalDocs(toType(value, ExternalDocumentation.class));
896         case "host" -> setHost(Utils.s(value));
897         case "info" -> setInfo(toType(value, Info.class));
898         case "parameters" -> setParameters(mapBuilder(String.class,ParameterInfo.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
899         case "paths" -> setPaths(mapBuilder(String.class,OperationMap.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
900         case "produces" -> setProduces(listBuilder(MediaType.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
901         case "responses" -> setResponses(mapBuilder(String.class,ResponseInfo.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
902         case "schemes" -> setSchemes(listBuilder(String.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
903         case "security" -> setSecurity((List)listBuilder(Map.class,String.class,List.class,String.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
904         case "securityDefinitions" -> setSecurityDefinitions(mapBuilder(String.class,SecurityScheme.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
905         case "swagger" -> setSwagger(Utils.s(value));
906         case "tags" -> setTags(listBuilder(Tag.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
907         default -> {
908            super.set(property, value);
909            yield this;
910         }
911      };
912   }
913
914   @Override /* SwaggerElement */
915   public Set<String> keySet() {
916      var s = setBuilder(String.class)
917         .addIf(basePath != null, "basePath")
918         .addIf(consumes != null, "consumes")
919         .addIf(definitions != null, "definitions")
920         .addIf(externalDocs != null, "externalDocs")
921         .addIf(host != null, "host")
922         .addIf(info != null, "info")
923         .addIf(parameters != null, "parameters")
924         .addIf(paths != null, "paths")
925         .addIf(produces != null, "produces")
926         .addIf(responses != null, "responses")
927         .addIf(schemes != null, "schemes")
928         .addIf(security != null, "security")
929         .addIf(securityDefinitions != null, "securityDefinitions")
930         .addIf(swagger != null, "swagger")
931         .addIf(tags != null, "tags")
932         .build();
933      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
934   }
935
936   /**
937    * A synonym of {@link #toString()}.
938    * @return This object serialized as JSON.
939    */
940   public String asJson() {
941      return toString();
942   }
943
944   @Override /* Object */
945   public String toString() {
946      return JsonSerializer.DEFAULT.toString(this);
947   }
948
949   /**
950    * Resolves a <js>"$ref"</js> tags to nodes in this swagger document.
951    *
952    * @param <T> The class to convert the reference to.
953    * @param ref The ref tag value.
954    * @param c The class to convert the reference to.
955    * @return The referenced node, or <jk>null</jk> if the ref was <jk>null</jk> or empty or not found.
956    */
957   public <T> T findRef(String ref, Class<T> c) {
958      if (Utils.isEmpty(ref))
959         return null;
960      if (! ref.startsWith("#/"))
961         throw new BasicRuntimeException("Unsupported reference:  ''{0}''", ref);
962      try {
963         return new ObjectRest(this).get(ref.substring(1), c);
964      } catch (Exception e) {
965         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e, c, "Reference ''{0}'' could not be converted to type ''{1}''.", ref, className(c));
966      }
967   }
968}
